<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 171, 195, 186]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 166, 235]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 260]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[724, 220, 720, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[867, 220, 864, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[869, 244, 880, 259]]<|/det|> <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 231, 294]]<|/det|> # MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[827, 279, 905, 294]]<|/det|> 979/33 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 304, 311, 318]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[765, 305, 905, 320]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[759, 330, 905, 344]]<|/det|> 1 hour 50 minutes <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 391, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 225, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 467]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 867, 545]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 620]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 715]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 661, 96]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Sketch the graph of \(y=|3 x-2 a|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 617, 527]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence or otherwise solve the inequality \(|3 x-2 a|<x+5 a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 535, 93]]<|/det|>
2 Solve the equation \(2 \ln (2 x+3)-\ln (2 x+5)=\ln (3 x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 428, 121]]<|/det|>
3 Find the exact value of \(\int_{\frac{1}{5} \pi}^{\frac{1}{4} \pi} 3 \cos ^{2} 5 x \mathrm{~d} x\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 493, 99]]<|/det|>
4 (a) It is given that \(z_{1}=r_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta_{1}}\) and \(z_{2}=r_{2} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta_{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 109, 374, 128]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\left(z_{1} z_{2}\right)^{*}=z_{1}{ }^{*} z_{2}{ }^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 727, 528]]<|/det|>
(b) \(z=3 \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4} \pi \mathrm{i}}\) is a root of the equation \(z^{2}+b z+c=0\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 540, 598, 557]]<|/det|>
State the other root and hence find the values of \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 446, 95]]<|/det|>
5 The equation of a curve is \(x y+y^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-x}=4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 113, 361, 151]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=\frac{y^{2}-y \mathrm{e}^{x}}{x \mathrm{e}^{x}+2 y}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 659, 617, 676]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the gradients of the tangents to the curve when \(x=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 919, 105]]<|/det|>
6 Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z+4}{z+4 \mathrm{i}}\) is real and \(|z|=\sqrt{10}\). Give your answers in the form \(z=x+\mathrm{i} y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 584, 107]]<|/det|>
7 Let \(\mathrm{f}(x)=\frac{3 a-5 x}{(3 a+2 x)(2 a-x)}\) ，where \(a\) is a positive constant．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 410, 138]]<|/det|>
（a）Express \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in partial fractions．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[973, 231, 989, 382]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[973, 426, 989, 577]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 918, 97]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 710, 703, 728]]<|/det|>
(c) State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion in part (b) is valid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 565, 97]]<|/det|>
8 (a) Prove the identity \(\cot ^{2} \theta-\tan ^{2} \theta \equiv 4 \cot 2 \theta \operatorname{cosec} 2 \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 697, 97]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence solve the equation \(\cot ^{2} x-\tan ^{2} x=5 \sec 2 x\) for \(0^{\circ}<x<90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 753, 91]]<|/det|>
9 With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A, B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 99, 725, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}, \quad \overrightarrow{O B}=\mathbf{i}+3 \mathbf{j}-2 \mathbf{k} \quad \text { and } \quad \overrightarrow{O C}=2 \mathbf{i}-\mathbf{j}+3 \mathbf{k}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 388, 153]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) passes through \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 377, 182]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a vector equation for \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 590, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) The point \(P\) is the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 536, 388, 553]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 516, 451, 536]]<|/det|>
(c) The point \(D\) is the reflection of \(A\) in \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 546, 391, 567]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 74, 535, 91]]<|/det|>
10 The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 94, 603, 128]]<|/det|>
\[
\sin 4 y \frac{\mathrm{~d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=x \sin 2 y \sin 3 x
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 131, 421, 155]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y=\frac{1}{12} \pi\) when \(x=\frac{1}{2} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 689, 184]]<|/det|>
(a) Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\) and \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 513, 603, 537]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(0<y<\frac{1}{2} \pi\), find the values of \(y\) when \(x=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 105, 90]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 92, 621, 228]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 251, 918, 274]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y=\sqrt{x} \sin 2 x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x=a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 302, 344, 319]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that \(\tan 2 a=-4 a\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 731, 485, 750]]<|/det|>
(b) Show by calculation that \(0.9<a<0.95\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 656, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that if a sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[399, 97, 601, 130]]<|/det|>
\[
x_{n+1}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\pi-\tan ^{-1}\left(4 x_{n}\right)\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 136, 421, 153]]<|/det|>
converges, then it converges to \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 503, 921, 520]]<|/det|>
(d) Use the iterative formula in part (c) to calculate \(a\) correct to 4 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
